positive.review:
Ive never yelled at my friend more than this game

Its not a relaxing cooking game

The first few days are chill

Then you are swamped


10/10 would yell at my friend like an abusive relationship over food again

Imagine if Overcooked! required you to make good business decisions on top of speedy cooking and service abilities.  That is this game, but with the extra benefit of making everyone who plays it super mad at one another at every turn.  The chaos that erupts from this game's relentless requirement of perfect execution is nothing short of hilarious when you gather a group of 3-4 incompetent players with worse communication skills.  Good game.

Can't believe I've never written a review for this game yet! Absolutely 100% recommend this to anyone who wants to play it! I loved trying to do Overcooked but the funky environments and things really threw me off. This doesn't have that by default although there's some extra shenanigans that can be had for some theme maps. HOWEVER! The recipes are great and very akin to real life ones and while everything before overtime is easy for me now, it's still fun as hell! The mechanics are great and it's fun both for solo and multiplayer play!

The concept of this game is simple. Make food, give it to customers. Rinse and repeat.
But the DEPTH and BALANCE of the game is astounding.

 Each recipe has its own quirks and difficulties that make them feel distinctly different - not only will a fish restaurant operate differently from a cake restaurant, but one pie restaurant may feel different from another pie restaurant just due to the RNG of options you get as your restaurant progresses through the days, leading to a unique experience every time. 

I play this with friends as a 4 player game, and appreciate how different the game feels in each role - if you spend all your time in the kitchen, you are playing a fundamentally different game than the person running orders to customers, or the person managing dirty plates, or the person managing any other number of tasks. All the roles are engaging, and we've all found enjoyment in different aspects of the game. 

It's also just satisfying. Every time you manage to optimize the workflow just a bit more, it feels rewarding, making you feel more empowered to tackle the next big problem area. 
There's also tons of content - we still haven't unlocked everything!
TLDR: good game, I like
one of the most funniest game i have ever played especially with my friends, its pretty hard tho
fantastic game to play with friends. it's a rougelike version of overcooked
Very good game, but the coffee level is not possible cause you only have 1 table at the start.
Such a fun well paced game. Its fun to play with tons of people, but also very enjoyable solo!
Gameplay wise I enjoy it more than Overcooked 2. Just more simple, still very tedious, and demanding, but less chaotic than Overcooked 2. Really like it, and much more enjoyable with friends.

At 100 hours there is pretty much no new content, but I still play it with my sister cause we too lazy to look for other games.
It is pretty good couch co-op funzies
a lot of fun with friends! the progression system makes this game really addicting

Yes. Get it.

Easy to learn, difficult to master. While not *the* most difficult, you can sink a lot of time into learning automation for the different recipes. It is very satisfying when you get to overtime day 20 and your restaurant is just running (mostly) by itself.**

**with certain recipes. Good luck if you choose pasta without the mod that lets you dump the water in the sink.

I've had a lot of fun with friends and family, as well - more than two can get a little overwhelming, for me at least.

Steam workshop mods are a great addition.

It's also very easy to run. The game has a Nintendo Switch port. If your PC is more powerful than that, it'll run the game just fine.
This game tickles every one of my little idiosyncratic gaming addictions. Such a great distraction from the world!
fun party game but definitely something that forces you to play in a party

the artstyle is great and its way too fun with friends. the only downside is the game doesnt explicitly tell you how to combine/upgrade/best utilize things, so you have to find out yourself through the wiki

I usually hate diner dash games.. they are always so stressful.  That said, I LOVE this game.  The automation items and roguelike system that lets you bring in items here and there.. makes this game enjoyable even for filthy casuals like me.  A little stress early on, into full automation dopamine in the end.  Very fun!

Obsessed with this game, played it endlessly on Xbox One S. It recently broke and now I have it on PC. I've only played it for an hour, but on Xbox I've been playing it since the start of the year. Happy to be back.

I like how you can play with freinds via one pc. I just really love the game, its so fun. automating your restaurants, the small amount of stress, that just provides that extra sense of accoumplishment.
Its a perfect game. I wish i could find more couch co-op that scratches the itch this game does.
PlateUp! is best played with friends, but the solo experience is also fantastic and automation is the cherry on top.
this is the best cooking game ive ever played. my friend and I play this all the time, you don't even need mods (which there are many good ones) to keep discovering fun new things to do.

Disclaimer: I've played a bit of coop, but this review is mainly about the single player experience.

This game looks a lot like Overcooked. 

I think that’s unfortunate, because at its heart, this is a very different game for a very different audience. PlateUp! Is a roguelike where you build up a restaurant, using increasingly more automation to serve more guest and/or more complicated recipes, basically creating a ‘human in the loop’ machine. That's why it almost feels a bit like the early game of factorio to me, which is obviously VERY different from Overcooked.

What gives this game such replay-ability is what is arguably the most important thing for every roguelike: A catching gameplay loop where you constantly have to decide how to use your limited/given resources. To everyone regularly playing roguelikes, I don’t have to tell you how satisfying it is to create a build that works, how great it feels to role just the thing you needed. Or arguably even better, to not get the thing you needed and still make it work somehow.

Use your belts to fully automate your burger production but do the serving and dishwashing fully by hand? Or use a few of your machines to optimize your dishwashing process, resulting in having to cut tomatoes by hand every now and then? Take on another recipe or more guests? Which would be more time efficient and, maybe more importantly, which can your brain handle better without f*ing up everything?
Great game to put your friendship to the test. Or to get closer, all up to the player, the game loop is perfect for it.
i really like this game, but i have to knock off some points for inaccuracy, the customers in game are far too patient compared to real life.
enough to fill your free time with a game that is not too difficult but challenging

Great game.  My buddy and I had a lot of fun playing this.  I've seen game play from more experienced players, looks very complex, however, you can learn pretty quickly what to go for and what to avoid for future runs.  STAY AWAY FROM MAKING COFFEE!!!  xD  So boring!

Me and my homies fucking hate management co-op games because at first we're like "Oh this'll be a fun game to play" and then an hour in we're screaming over each other trying to tell each other what needs to be done. 

Highly recommend, get it for all your friends.
I can't believe I waited so long to get this game. I have loved every second playing. Even solo I find such joy trying to automate all the recipes.
Super fun to play with friends and even by yourself!
Very fun and relaxing to play. Great for casual coop!
Very fun game either solo or in co-op! It's challenging and varied in the ways you can play, which i enjoy as opposed to something like Overcooked.

Absolute peak.

Best combination of roguelike, automation and overcooked. I have 100% this game and except for the xp grind because of new recepies, I have enjoyed every single second.

Sometimes simple and repetetive tasks again and again without a brain (still super fun btw) and sometimes, you sit there with your friend and engeneer your perfect setup to speed but a small bit your kitchen, just to do it again next day

great game, absolutelly recommend
and play it with friends, it makes it 1000x better

This game plays like Overcooked but as a choose your own adventure. You have far more agency on how any given play through and you won't be blindsided by an exceedingly difficult level unless you choose that to be the case. It isn't a ton of fun solo, but with 2 or more people I've found it to be a blast and definitely one to have in your party games list.

Pros: fun gameplay, great in-game music, fun cooking skills, Co-Op, and memories.
Cons: annoying main menu music, sluggish controls, ugly looking AOL men.

This game has been a lot of fun, both solo and with others. They are both two very different experiences, that's for sure. With solo feeling like it's more about how to min-max your movement as much as possible, where as with others is more about co-operation. So if you're worried about not being able to play this because you lack people to play with, I'd still say it's worth a try if it looks interesting to you.

I honestly prefer this over games like Overcooked. Sure, the graphics are a bit more basic than that game, and they share a lot of the same DNA, I enjoy how this one is a lot more focused on solely the moment to moment game play, and an emphasis on building up your restaurant, rather than jumping from level to level with various gimmicks. You really could use an extra oven, but you'll need to rearrange your kitchen to fit it. Or having to take on extra stuff your customers can order, to avoid getting overloaded with a that rush at closing time you had to take earlier in the run. It can get pretty chaotic.

And really, any game that has a 3 player option is always a nice bonus (I have two brothers and have trouble finding games that aren't fixed at 2 or 4 player.
this ellegant game was hand crafted by the develepors and im only writing this to waste time uhh i guess u could try this game with ur friends very fun to raigebait
I like to wash dishes. I take the plates and I bring them to the sink and I wash them. I hate the dishwasher because I am the dish washer. I can't let AI steal my job.
burning food, yelling at friends, getting stuck in customers mess, what more could you want?
123 easy as ABC baby you and me yea.... this game is like cutting a hole in a orange.
Best way I can describe it is if elden ring was a cooking game, 10/10

Experiencing an absence of stress and anger in life?

Try PlateUp!
Fun and roguelike great with friend
No ones gonna read this. so im just gonna say it.. im gay for franks long jank {franks hotdogs} he caught me doing the frank jank outback behind the fridge
A very fun and addictive game!
definitely not a substitute for Overcooked but it has its own fun loop
people shits in my restaurant when drinking coffee. 10/10
Don't let the review below me scare you they cooked pizza for 5 hours and we lost <3 much love gamers
I WILL KILL MY FRIEND BECAUSE HE IS A RETARD. 10/10 Game
so fun with friends and family
Really fun couch co-op style game.
cool things fun stuff
it updates has fun different maps
why starting a restaurant with your friends is a bad idea
the cutest little game !! i love the vibes
its like im working at nandos again
Great game tons of fun with friends

much fun, much chaos
this game made me feel like gordan ramsay. i love this game.

its quite good imo.

10/10 will cook again.

negative.review:
As far as I can tell, the way to build super busy automated restaurants like you see in screenshots is to make mass copies of items using unintuitive research bench + file cabinet mechanics.

If you don't want to fiddle with silly metagaming hijinks you have to barely scrape by while focusing on keeping menus as simple and limited as possible.

I don't really see how either of those options are any fun.
A wonderful premise ruined entirely by ridiculous difficulty in early parts of levels. Utterly off-putting and requires a mod to even remotely have fun.
Game is ok. Just feels too fast paced for me, prefer other like restaurant simulators. Probably would be more fun multiplayer.

This game seemed like a fun premise to mess around in, but unfortunately the performance is really bad on my PC (I am way above the required/recommended specs).  Hopefully the dev can figure out what's wrong and I'd be happy to change this to a thumbs up review
If you want to keep your sanity and friendship stay away. I have never had a game break my sanity as much as this one. i will never recover and be the same
Floor buffer, never have I been bent over and buffered so much before to the point Alt+F4, leading into potential depression.
worse game i have ever played. straight up overcooked 2 copy
its really bad dont bother
they made a typo in the game name: CringeUp!
Too many bugs. When I played with my friends, they got kicked out in the middle of the game. I also got stuck between the walls when decorating the rooms.

Keep in mind, this was my own experience with the game, and the experience I felt feels very specific and I've tried nearly everything to fix it despite the new "Fix"

Plateup as a game is very fun. To me, not as enjoyable as Overcooked, but it has some charm to it, however, my experience with the game has been so stale due to one simple problem. I can't play with my friends. For whatever reason, any time I join, there is lag. I've had one experience about a week ago from this review where it "worked", but I was running in slow motion...not sure what that is about. I've kept my expectations high, but there's only so many times you can before it fades out. As a solo game, it's just...not fun to me, and not being able to play with the 2 friends that have it killed the vibe for me on this game, so until there is a better fix implemented, I can't recommend this game
Game becomes immediate lags whenever I enter multiplayer mode. And it doesn't stop. Hence, it ruins my game experience with my partner.

PSA Do not buy multiple copies of this game if you want to play together with your friends.
Multiplayer server sucks ass right now, it lags constantly and ruined my experience. We had to resort to playing on remoteplay together on controllers just to play co-op.

Just buy one copy, and play with 3 other players.

Also, devs broke all the mods currently.
